Overrides.Override: You take 5% reduced Extra Damage from Critical Strikes
5% chance to Blind Enemies on Hit with Attacks

PathOfBuilding.Notes:
^xFFFF77---------- EXTREMELY IMPORTANT INFO ----------
^x70FF70-Leaguestart Regex^7 Copy the code below and paste it into Tarkleigh's search bar in Lioneye's Watch to highlight useful 3-link items:
g-g-b|g-[gb]-g|b-g-g|nne|rint
^x70FF70-Area of Effect ^7You need between 37-43% Increased Area of Effect to make all five of your ^x70FF70Toxic Rain^7 pods cleanly overlap. You get 20% from the Passive Skill Tree, and the rest from a combination of helm and gloves prefixes. You can also get Area of Effect as a corrupted belt implicit or a corrupted jewel implicit.
It's not a big concern during the leveling process.
^x70FF70-Should I do the Siosa quest? (A3 Library)^7 You don't have to, and it is out of the way, but it lets you buy ^x7070FFFlame Dash^7 and ^x7070FFMalevolence^7 before Act 6, so yeah.
^x70FF70-How to Fix Mana in the Campaign^7 Make a beeline to Primal Spirit in Act 1. Use ^x7070FFClarity^7 once it becomes available in Act 1. These will both really help solve mana early.
Don't overlevel ^x7070FFClarity^7, the mana reservation cost gets big pretty quickly.
Use your mana flask liberally, and spec toward Thrill of Battle on the right-hand side of the tree.
Note:^7 If you use ^x8888FFEldritch Battery^7, ^x70FF70Manaforged Arrows^7 will not work, because you're spending Energy Shield, not Mana. You will need to use ^xE05030Ballista Totems^7 with ^x70FF70Focused Ballista Support^7 for bossing, or ^x70FF70Caustic Arrow^7 with ^x70FF70Arrow Nova Support^7 for clearing.
^x70FF70-Fixing Mana at Endgame^7 Craft ^x8888FF-7 Mana Cost of Non-Channeling Skills^7 prefixes on your rings and amulet. The ^xE05030Searing Exarch^7's helm implicit modifier ^x8888FFX% Reduced Mana Cost of Attacks^7 is also important. Getting a high rank of that implicit by using ^xAF6025Orbs of Conflict^7 is really important for fixing mana at higher gear levels.
If you use ^x8888FFEldritch Battery^7, The Belt Suffix that grants ^x8888FFRegenerate 150 Energy Shield per second while a Rare or Unique Enemy is Nearby^7 is very good early on for maintaining your ES pool.
^xAF6025Devouring Diadem^7 is a unique helm that drops from Catarina, the end boss of Betrayal. It's will help fix mana problems, but you will need to compensate by getting Area of Effect elsewhere. It grants ^x8888FFEldritch Battery^7, which saves at least 2 Passive Points. It also massively reduces the difficulty of meeting reservation requirements. It doesn't have ^x70FF70Evasion^7, so hitting the ^x70FF70Spell Suppression^7 cap becomes more challenging due to the ^x70FF70Evasion^7 Mastery no longer functioning.
^x70FF70-Should I use Ballista Totems or Caustic Arrow as my second six-link?^7^7 ^x70FF70Toxic Rain^7 ^x70FF70Focused Ballista Totems^7 are a bit of a throwback. They help out with single-target damage by debuffing enemies, and are generally only used while fighting bosses and tanky rares. ^x70FF70Caustic Arrow^7 is better for clearing maps, but requires a two-button playstyle. Try playing with both, and see which you prefer (probably ^x70FF70Caustic Arrow^7)!
Once you get your mana fixed, you can use a ^x70FF70Manaforged Arrows Support^7 setup in your second six-link and get the value of two six-links with a single keybind!
^x70FF70-How should I use Immortal Call & Withering Step? Is Automation Support the play?^7 Yeah, it's really good!
^x70FF70-When can I swap out of Eldritch Battery?^7 Technically, you never NEED to run Eldritch Battery. It just trivializes mana for a while early on in the endgame.
Switching back to mana is preferable since it will enable the use of a ^x70FF70Manaforged Arrows^7 6-link. The ^x8888FFMana Cost with Attacks^7 wheel on the right side of the tree does wonders for reducing your mana costs. The ^xE05030Life^7 Mastery that grants^x8888FF Skills Cost Life instead of 15% of Mana Cost^7 also works really well.
You can use ^xE05030Lifetap Support^7 in your ^x70FF70Manaforged Arrows^7 setup to set its mana cost to 0. This will make it trigger on cooldown. This may not be necessary, just be sure to check your mana costs.
^xAF6025Stormshroud^7 or ^xAF6025Ancestral Vision^7 can help with fixing your Elemental Ailment Avoidance, since you won't be able to fit in Purity of Elements.
A ^xAF6025Watcher's Eye^7 that grants ^x8888FFNon-Channelling Skills have -10 to Total Mana Cost while affected by Clarity^7 can be useful, but they are usually expensive. It's not mandatory, either.
^x70FF70-How do I fit in all these auras?^7 We take two Reservation wheels. They help a lot. After that, you can use some combination of the following: -^x8888FFMana^7 Mastery that grants 12% Reservation Efficiency -^x7070FFEnlighten Support^7 linked to Auras -^x8888FFMana Reservation Efficiency^7 helm suffix from ^xB97123Essence of Loathing^7 -^x8888FFMana Reservation Efficiency^7 helm implicit from ^x3F6DB3Eater of Worlds^7 -Small ^x8888FFReservation Efficiency^7 Cluster Jewels with a notable for ^x70FF70Grace^7 (Sublime Form) or ^x70FF70Haste^7 (Frantic Aspect) -Anointing ^xFFFF77Sovereignty^7 (^xC8C8C8Silver Oil^7 x3) from the Templar side of the tree -^xAF6025Devouring Diadem^7 (Energy Shield helmet that drops from Catarina)
^x70FF70-What About Guardian's Blessing?^7 ^xE05030Guardian's Blessing Support^7 has a lot of positives. It's free! It's instant! It's permanent! It needs to be linked to both an aura and a minion gem. It burns the minion's health in order to maintain the aura. This is normally pretty bad, since you will need to recast a minion and apply the buff to it. Awful!
There is a minion that gets around this requirement: ^xD02090Dark Marionette^7 Spectres. They reform after dying, which means you can easily summon them once, then just hit them with the ^xE05030Guardian's Blessing^7 when they reform.
You can get ^xD02090Dark Marionette^7 Corpses through Ritual.
^x70FF70-What is the best anointment?^7 Initially, ^xD02090Potency of Will^7. You can reach it with a Very Large ^xAF6025Thread of Hope^7 in an endgame build.
^xFFFF77Sovereignty^7 is the best option once you have a ^xAF6025Thread of Hope^7.
If you are using a ^xAF6025Devouring Diadem^7 and ^xFFFF77Sovereignty^7, you can use ^xE05030Beastcrafting^7 to apply ^x70FF70Aspect of the Spider^7 onto a piece of gear as a suffix. ^x70FF70Aspect of the Spider^7 slows enemies by 30% & increases their damage taken by 5-10%. It's not bad.
^x70FF70-What kind of flasks should I use?^7 ^xE05030Life^7 Flask is a given. You want a prefix that grants Increased Life Recovered and Reduced Recovery Rate so that you don't have to hit the keybind as often to keep it active. I bind my life flask to my mouse. Make sure your ^xE05030Life^7 Flask has a "^x8888FFGrants Immunity to X^7" Suffix. ^xE05030Bleed^7/^xE05030Corrupted Blood^7 immunity is best. This will allow you to drink it even while at full health. ^xE05030Ruby^7, ^x3F6DB3Sapphire^7, and ^xADAA47Topaz^7 flasks all work really well in this build. They help fix resistances early on, and overcapping your ^x3F6DB3Cold^7 and ^xADAA47Lightning^7 Resistances so that you can safely farm ^x3F6DB3Blue Eldritch Altars^7 is a safe move. ^x70FF70Jade^7 and ^x8888FFQuartz^7 Flasks are both good alternatives during the campaign. ^x70FF70Jade^7 can remain good long-term, especially if using ^xAF6025Kintsugi^7. ^7Silver^7^7 adds both movement speed and attack speed. It's a no-brainer. Quicksilver adds movement speed. It's not required, but it's pretty close. This leaves room for one other flask. ^x70FF70Jade^7 and ^x8888FFQuartz^7 are good options.
^xD02090Progenesis^7 far outperforms the competition, but it is expensive.
^x70FF70-What is the best flask prefix?^7 Increased Charge Recovery will provide the most uptime on utility flasks. Increased Flask Duration and Reduced Charges Used are both decent. They're not as good, but not bad, either.
For ^xE05030Life^7 Flasks, as mentioned above: Increased Life Recovered and Reduced Recovery Rate is a mandatory prefix.
Once you have ^xAF6025The Tides of Time^7, you can use Increased Flask Effect, Reduced Duration as a Prefix on some flasks and still maintain 100% uptime.
^x70FF70-Which flask suffixes are important?^7 ^x8888FF% Chance to Avoid Being Stunned^7 will prevent you from being stunlocked to death. ^x8888FF% Reduced Effect of Curses^7 is great for QoL. ^x8888FF% Chance to Avoid Being Shocked^7 is excellent for becoming Elemental Ailment immune if using ^xAF6025Stormshroud^7. ^x8888FF% Increased Evasion Rating^7 is good defensively. Attack Speed is no longer available as a flask suffix. This kinda sucks, but it's okay, we just go after defensive utility from flasks.
^x70FF70-Tattoos are back! Which ones should I use?^7 This was unexpected, but good! The ^x70FF70Tattoo of the Tawhoa Herbalist^7 replaces ^x70FF70Dexterity^7 small passive nodes and grants 4% increased Flask Effect Duration. They aren't mandatory, but they are *VERY* good. You can use other tattoos to solve problems in your gear, but no others are this generically useful.
^x70FF70-Is ^7^xAF6025The Tides of Time^7 ^x70FF70belt from Uber Shaper good?^7 It is. It easily grants permanent flask uptime and significant increased flask effect, enough to outperform even the juiciest rare flask belts, and unlike a ^xAF6025Mageblood^7, it applies to ^xAF6025Unique^7 flasks. When combined with ^xAF6025Progenesis^7, this provides far more defensive value than any other unique in the game can offer. You can push into the 300+ Life/sec range with ^xAF6025The Tides of Time^7 equipped. That's a preposterous amount of life regen.
It does come from an Uber Pinnacle boss, but Uber Shaper is generally regarded as the easiest Uber boss, and the droprate was fairly high during Patch 3.24.
The implicit modifier is not great, so there's a real incentive to double-corrupt it and try to get attack speed or skill effect duration.
^x70FF70
^xFFFF77---------- LEAGUE START INFO ----------^7
^x70FF70-What skill should I use in Act 1?^7 ^7^x70FF70Caustic Arrow^7 is very good for most of Act 1. Its main source of damage is the pool it leaves on the ground, and it doesn't overlap, so you don't have to spam it on bosses. ^x70FF70Puncture^7 helps a lot on Brutus. That is its only use.
Swap to ^x70FF70Toxic Rain^7 at level 12. You can continue using ^x70FF70Caustic Arrow^7 against Merveil if you have a socket for it. If you manage to maintain a couple of 3-link setups throughout the campaign, you can continue using ^x70FF70Caustic Arrow^7 with ^x70FF70Arrow Nova Support^7 and ^x70FF70Pierce Support^7, just like you would at endgame.
This is not mandatory, it's just an option that can give you the feel of playing the endgame build during the campaign.
^xD02090I greatly prefer the two-button playstyle, which is not something I can say about literally any other build.^7
^x70FF70-Early Leveling Tips:^7 Look for movement speed boots, quicksilver flasks, and 3 ^x70FF70green^7-link items. Don't waste time killing ^xFFFF77rares^7 unless you can do so really efficiently. Focus on killing ^x8888FFmagic^7 packs for XP and ^xC8C8C8white^7 mobs to keep your flasks full. Keep moving! Leveling in Path of Exile involves a lot of walking!
Get a ^x3F6DB3Sapphire Ring^7 (or two) before fighting Merveil.
Finding a 4-link is your first big gearing goal (level 25+). You either want 4^x70FF70g^7 or 3^x70FF70g^71^x7070FFb^7. Use ^x7070FFEfficacy^7 as your ^x7070FFBlue^7 Support Gem. 3^x70FF70g^71^xE05030r^7 or 2^x70FF70g^71^x7070FFb^71^xE05030r^7 can work, but it's not as good. Use ^xE05030More Duration Support^7 or ^xE05030Damage on Full Life Support^7 as your Red Support Gem.
^x8888FFNOTE:^7 If using ^xE05030Damage on Full Life Support^7, be sure to take the Life Mastery that grants "You count as on Full Life while at 90% maximum health or above."
^x70FF70-Auras^7 ^x7070FFClarity^7. It's free mana regen. Pick it up at level 10, use it throughout the entire campaign. Don't overlevel it. Anywhere in the level 5-8 range is a good stopping point.
^x70FF70^x7070FFSummon Skitterbots^7^7 is the best aura available when it becomes available early in Act 2, but it quickly drops in value compared to alternatives like those listed below. (Use it for a while, but be prepared to drop it when the time comes. Continue leveling it in your offhand.)
^x70FF70Haste^7^7 is the best aura in the campaign because it makes you move faster. It's not amazing for fighting bosses.
Switch to ^x7070FFMalevolence^7 for more single-target damage.
^x7070FFPurity of Elements^7 helps with capping resists and being ailment immune. ^x70FF70 Grace^7 is a great defensive aura, and you can use it to massively increase your tankiness if you find yourself struggling defensively at any point. It's mainly just for not dying to random packs of ^x8888FFmagic^7 and ^xFFFF77rare^7 monsters, which is very useful, but swapping auras during the campaign will make the experience faster and smoother. ^x70FF70Grace^7 won't make you faster or add damage, and it's mostly worthless against most bosses.
^xFFFF77---------- EARLY ENDGAME ----------^7
^x70FF70-Kitava's dead. What now?^7 Level up in ^xE05030Blood Aqueducts^7 or ^xD02090The Quarry^7 until you are around level 68. Start progressing your atlas. Farm currency in easy content. Your damage will suck a bit, but you are super fast, so Heist is perfect. This build is outstanding for Labrunning, if you're willing to do it.
Farming Alva & Bestiary^7 in low-tier white maps is a really strong, easy strategy early in a league. Alch-and-Go Expedition^7^7^7 Farming is great, too. Betrayal is a profitable league mechanic early, and it can create some really useful gear at leaguestart. I usually farm Betrayal and Expedition at league start, since they both provide gear and Expedition gives a lot of bubblegum currency.
I'm also a big fan of Essences, although they are a little more annoying to set up and run at league start now that they require ^xFFFF77T6+^7 maps in order to maximize their value.
Try to get a ^xAF6025Quill Rain^7 or a 6-link Short Bow from ^xAF6025The Porcupine^7 Divination Cards. This will help your damage out a lot! Craft the Short Bow using ^xD02090Shrieking Essence of Dread^7 for +2 bow gems. Craft Attack Speed, or Chaos DoT Multi if you get Attack Speed on the bow.
Farming Betrayal for ^xAF6025Devouring Diadem^7 from Catarina can be really valuable.
Get a ^xAF6025Kintsugi^7 as soon as you can, it will substantially improve your overall tankiness.
^xAF6025Lightning Coil^7 has been a popular chest option in the past, and it's still good, but the downside of -60 Lightning Resistance is pretty brutal. It's more reliable than ^xAF6025Kintsugi^7 is at high gear levels, but early on it's not as good.
Fix your stats, get your flasks set up, keep your resistances up, level your gems, and start saving to craft a +3 ^x70FF70Thicket Bow^7 & buy an ^xE05030Empower Support^7.
^xFFFF77---------- ENDGAME FAQ ----------^7
^x70FF70-What Cluster Jewels Should I Use?^7 ^xC8C8C8^7Large ^xD02090Chaos^7 ^xD02090Damage^7 Cluster Jewels with 8 mods. The preferred notables are ^xD02090Unholy Grace^7, ^xD02090Unwaveringly Evil^7, and ^xD02090Wicked Pall^7.
Medium ^x70FF70Projectile Damage^7 Cluster Jewels with ^xFFFF77Shrieking Bolts^7 and ^xFFFF77Repeater^7 are the best option for maximizing damage.
Medium ^xD02090Chaos Damage^7 Over Time Cluster Jewels with ^xD02090Wicked Pall^7 and ^xD02090Student of Decay^7 are a good alternative that can help with ^xD02090Chaos Resistance^7. The difference in damage is pretty small.
^x70FF70^x70FF70^x70FF70-Do I need specific Jewels?^7 Nope! Jewels and Rare gear are about solving problems. You need a certain amount of resistances, stats, and spell suppression to make the build function safely. Acquire them across all those pieces of gear as you are able.
^x70FF70-Is the Thread of Hope necessary?^7 No, but it is a potential endgame optimization that lets you anoint ^xFFFF77Sovereignty^7 without losing the massive damage from ^xFFFF77Potency of Will^7.
-^x70FF70Do you need a Despair curse-on-hit ring?^7 No, but it's convenient! Many players self-cast ^xD02090Despair^7 on rares and bosses, but that's tedious.
^x70FF70-Do I need Forbidden Flesh/Flame?^7 No! They're a super expensive flex, and a really bad investment unless you can get lucky and buy them cheap. They do add a lot of damage/speed, though!
^x70FF70-What Watcher's Eye mods should I use?^7 ^x8888FFPhasing while Haste is Active^7 is pretty good, and surprisingly cheap. You can get Phasing elsewhere, but this is a really easy spot for it that costs very little. ^x8888FF^x8888FFIncreased Damage Over Time Multiplier While Affected By Malevolence^7 adds a ton of damage, which is great, but it is insanely expensive with other useful mods. If you are trying to transition out of using Eldritch Battery, using a ^xAF6025Watcher's Eye^7 that grants ^x8888FFNon-Channelling Skills have -(10-5) to Total Mana Cost while affected by Clarity^7 is extremely useful for fixing mana costs, but beware, it can be expensive!
^x70FF70-Why not use Headhunter?^7 ^xAF6025The Tides of Time^7, mostly. It just outclasses every other option in the belt slot for Pathfinder builds, and it's not really even close.
^xAF6025Headhunter^7 is very fun, but since this build deals ^xD02090Chaos DoT^7 instead of ^xC8C8C8physical^7 or ^xFFFF77elemental^7 damage, it's not quite as good as it is for normal bow builds like ^x70FF70Lightning Arrow^7. ^xAF6025 ^xAF6025Headhunter^7 can add tons of projectiles and attack speed, which may make the game perform poorly if using ^x70FF70Toxic Rain^7 MTX.
^x70FF70-Why not run Defiance of Destiny?^7 Damage! A +2 neck grants ~25% more damage than a ^xAF6025Defiance of Destiny^7. ^xAF6025Defiance of Destiny^7 is a great amulet. It will make you UNREASONABLY tanky, and it is much cheaper, it just comes at the expense of some damage. It also makes fixing mana more difficult.
^x70FF70-Why not all 3 Ele Res Flasks?^7 Same reason! It's a super-tanky setup that works great, but you have to give up some damage & speed for it! No thanks!
^x70FF70-Do I really need to use a ^xE05030Life^7 ^x70FF70Flask?^7^7 ^xAF6025Defiance of Destiny^7 is a decent alternative, but you will need to account for DoT effects and find another way to deal with ^xE05030Bleed^7 & ^xE05030Corrupted Blood^7. If you choose to not run a ^xE05030Life^7 Flask, ^xAF6025The Tides of Time^7 loses a ton of value, as well. This is more of an argument to just stick with a ^xE05030Life^7 Flask than it is to not use ^xAF6025The Tides of Time^7. ^xE05030Corrupted Blood^7 immunity through Corrupted Jewels will work, but for ^xE05030Bleed^7 you will probably want to run ^xE05030Steelskin^7 instead of ^xE05030Immortal Call^7 or switch to Ralakesh for your Minor Pantheon.

Skill.label: Puncture - Good for killing Brutus, that's it
Toxic Rain - Use supports in order
Dash - Keep using until you switch to Flame Dash
Withering Step - Shares a CD with Dash
Flame Dash - Buy from A3 Library or A6 Lilly
Auras - Level 24, use 1 at a time to start
Purity of Elements - Level 24, level in offhand
Can use Haste or Malevolence instead of Purity!
